err_create_user: Oops! :) A technical problem occurred. The page will automatically refresh itself to get you restart on solid bases. If the problem persists, do not hesitate to contact me at thibaud.chassin@epfl.ch. I'll make sure it doesn't happen again!
err_empty_field: This field must contain at least 1 character
err_too_much_char: You're very talkative! I'm sorry, the maximum number of characters is 1000...
err_not_email: Your email is not recognized as such. It's maybe a typo. If you don't want to give it to me, check the box 'I don't want to answer'.
verif-age-content: To continue this study, you must have the permission of your parents..
verif-age-valid: My parents allowed me to continue
verif-age-cancel: I will not continue this study
verif-no-previous: This feature has been disabled to prevent you from leaving this page unintentionally (•‿•)
intro-we-bienvenue:
Welcome, thank you very much for taking some time to respond to this study. I am Thibaud Chassin, a second-year PhD student. My research focuses on the use of collaborative 3D digital models in urban planning.
I will help you throughout this study. Your answers are precious to me because they will allow me to better understand how you perceive 3D digital models. The purpose of this experiment is to help me to legitimize the use of these models in participatory approaches. In other words, to give you new possibilities, as a citizen, to share your opinion and make your voice heard in urban development projects.
intro-we-etude: This study should take about 20 minutes.
intro-we-computer: A computer is required to answer the questions. The mobile version is unfortunately not yet planned.
intro-we-contact:

intro-pl-socio: Fill-in-the-gaps to get to know you better (~ 2 min)
intro-pl-comment: Your personal feedback on the study (~ 2 min)
intro-cc-volontariat: Your participation is completely voluntary. You are free to stop at any time without notice.
intro-cc-anonymat: Your answers will be collected and analyzed anonymously and confidentially.
socio-in-title: , I need your help to make this paragraph about you..
socio-in-secondaire-général: pursed school but did not graduate
socio-vd-question: Below is a bottle filled with water. The water is represented in black. The bottle is tilted at an angle of 30°. Which of the solutions indicates the correct water level?
perc-in-consigne:
In this activity, I will show you a 3D mock-up with a question. Answer it as well as you can !
To avoid any surprises, the questions that you will face look like this: What is the highest/lowest building? Can you see this object from that location? Which 2D map does this 3D model correspond to?

To help you answer the question, you can rotate the mock-up with the keyboard keys:
- [ up, down ] -> vertical rotation
- [ right, left ] -> horizontal rotation

Know that all your answers count, they are all equally instructive and important for the results of this study (•‿•).
perc-tut-consigne:
, it's time to practice!
The next questions will not count for results of the study. The goal of this step is to get used to the tasks I'm going to ask you afterwards.

The scene you're about to see has been heavily simplified.
perc-tut-resend: Your results will be available at the very end of the study.
perc-lod-leaflet:
Which one of these maps (right) corresponds to this 3D scene (left)?

You can manipulate the 3D scene
perc-lod-leaflet-light: Which one of these maps (right) corresponds to this 3D scene (left)?
perc-help-3d:
Keyboard keys up, down left and right to manipulate the scene.
The vertical view has been blocked at a maximum angle of 45°. This is to ensure that you see the scene only in 3D. However, you can rotate around it as much as you want (•‿•).
perc-lod-height:
Which one of these buildings is the highest?

Click the building on the map
perc-lod-height-light: Which one of these buildings is the highest?
perc-lod-low:
Which one of these buildings is the lowest?

Click the building on the map
perc-lod-low-light: Which one of these buildings is the lowest?
perc-lod-view: You're at the location of the red sphere. Are the green spheres visible from your position or not?
perc-lod-view0: None of the spheres are visible
perc-lod-view1: Only the nearest sphere is visible
perc-lod-view1b: Only the farthest sphere is visible
perc-atel-explanation: Now that you warmed up, we will start for real (•‿•).
perc-lod-ready: Get ready to see a new 3D scene!
perc-lod-time0: Good luck! You will interract with a total of 6 scenes.
perc-mem-title: , I will change the rules of the game (•‿•).
perc-mem-consigne:
Your next task will proceed as shown below:

1. You will see a question (without the 3D scene) with the possible answers.
2. You will see the 3D scene without the answers.
3. You will see the possible answers a second time to reply to the question. The 3D scene will be hidden !

Memorize the 3D scene to answer the question!
You will not be able to come back to the 3D scene once you have seen it.
perc-mem-map:
Which one of these maps corresponds the 3D scene?

The 3D scene will appear once you click on next. Caution the answers will disappear.
perc-mem-map2: Which one of these maps corresponds to the 3D scene that you have seen?
perc-mem-height:
Which one of these buildings is the highest?

The 3D scene will appear once you click on next. Caution the answers will disappear.
perc-mem-perf: How difficult would you rate the fact that you could not visualize the question and the 3D scene at the same time comparing to the first questions? That was...
perc-sta-title: , I'm going to change the rules of the game one last time (•‿•).
perc-sta-consigne: For the next two questions (the last of study), the interactive 3D scene will be replaced by two static images. Answer the questions as best as you can.<b>
perc-sta-perf: How difficult would you rate the fact that you could only use static images compared to an interactive 3D scene?
feed-in-title2: ! You have completed the hardest part of the study (•‿•)
feed-in-consigne: Now it's your turn to speak up. The next few questions will allow you to give me feedback on your reactions during this study.
perc-lod-buildings: How many buildings do you think were present on average in the scenes you have seen? (It is the same number in each scene)
feed-ev-question: What was the 3D scene where you felt <u>most comfortable</u> perceiving the height of the buildings?
feed-hv-question: In which 3D scene the perception of the height of buildings was the most difficult ?
reponse-no-none: None of the 3D scenes that I have seen
feed-xp-question: How would you rate your overall experience at the end of this study?
feed-di-question: How would you rate the overall difficulty of the proposed tasks?
feed-co-question: Is there anything else you want to tell me? (How did you hear about this study? Why did you complete this experiment? A personal feeling, etc.)
feed-em-question: Would you like to be informed of the outcome of the study?
feed-em-surveys: Yes, I would also like to participate in other studies
feed-em-interviews: Yes, I would also be willing to meet with you to discuss this study in more detail
feed-em-question+: In that case, can you give me your email address so I can get in touch with you?
feed-ty-thanks: All your answers have been recorded! Thank you very much for the time you have dedicated to this study.
feed-ty-hardest: The scene that gave you the most trouble
feed-ty-easiest: The scene where you were the best
feed-ty-questionhard: The question that was most difficult for you
perc-tut-res-first: You are one of the first people to complete this study, THANK YOU !
perc-tut-res-accuracy2: % of those who completed the study!
end-thanks: This study is carried out thanks to a partnership between the IGN's LASTIG laboratory (thank you Sidonie Christophe and Guillaume Touya for your commitment), the EPFL's LaSIG lab (where I am doing my thesis under the supervision of François Golay) and the INSIT institute of the HEIG-VD (thank you Jens Ingensand, my thesis co-director, and Florent Joerin). This research is partly funded by a grant from the IAMG [iamg.org].
